wikipedia_page.main:
For the New York politician, see Walter B. Langley.

Walter Langley (8 June 1852 – 21 March 1922) was an English painter and founder of the Newlyn School of plein air artists.
Error in 'Langley's entry in the Royal Birminghsm Society of Artists. The supposed date of this entry - 1894 - is not consistent with the postage stamp issued in the reign of George V (1911 - 1936)
